## Problem

Different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux) handle environment variables differently.  Using `NODE_ENV=production` directly in a command may not work correctly on Windows. `cross-env` provides a consistent way to set and use environment variables regardless of the platform.

## Solution

`cross-env` sets environment variables for your scripts, enabling platform-independent commands. Use it like you would on a POSIX system.  `cross-env` handles the underlying differences.


## Installation

```bash
npm install --save-dev cross-env
```

**Important:** Double-check package names during installation to avoid potentially malicious packages.

> **Node.js Compatibility:** Version 7 of `cross-env` requires Node.js 10 or higher.  For Node.js 8 or lower, install version 6:
>
> ```bash
> npm install --save-dev cross-env@6
> ```


## Usage

**Basic Example:**

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "build": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production webpack --config build/webpack.config.js"
  }
}
```

This sets `NODE_ENV` to `production` and then executes the `webpack` command.

**Multiple Variables:**

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "build": "cross-env FIRST_ENV=one SECOND_ENV=two node my-program.js"
  }
}
```

**Using `cross-env-shell` (for commands with shell syntax):**

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "greet": "cross-env-shell GREETING=Hi NAME=Joe \"echo $GREETING && echo $NAME\""
  }
}
```

**Important Considerations for Windows:**

- For scripts requiring complex shell functionality or signal handling (e.g., `SIGINT`), use `cross-env-shell`.
- If using `npm` scripts and command substitution, update your `.npmrc` file to use PowerShell (for better command substitution support). [Learn more](https://github.com/kentcdodds/cross-env/issues/192#issuecomment-513341729).

**Handling JSON Strings:**

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "test": "cross-env TS_NODE_COMPILER_OPTIONS=\"{\\\"module\\\":\\\"commonjs\\\"}\" node my-test.js"
  }
}
```

**Crucial for JSON strings:** Use double backslashes (`\\`) for escaping characters *within* the JSON string,  *not* around the entire JSON string.


## Alternatives


- [`env-cmd`](https://github.com/toddbluhm/env-cmd) (for reading from files)
- [`@naholyr/cross-env`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@naholyr/cross-env) (with default value support)


## Contributing

If you'd like to contribute, please check the [issues](https://github.com/kentcdodds/cross-env/issues) for open tasks.
